item.title: April 8th: Fixing Positioning Issues
item.description: I realized that the positioning of my 3D models was off on smaller screens. After some debugging, I managed to fix the positioning issues and made sure the models looked good on all screen sizes.

item.title: April 5th: First Batch of 3D Models
item.description: I made some good progress today! I added the first batch of 3D models to my scene, including a Michelangelo statue and a woman model. I used the GLTFLoader in Three.js to import the models and spent some time adjusting their positions and scales.

item.title: April 3rd: Diving Deeper into Three.js
item.description: Today was all about diving deeper into Three.js. I set up a canvas and started working on adding some 3D models to my scene. I encountered a few challenges with positioning the models correctly and adjusting the scale, but I managed to make some progress.

item.title: April 2nd: Starting My 3D Website Journey
item.description: Hey everyone! Today, I decided to start a new project. I've always been fascinated by 3D graphics and web development, so I thought, why not combine the two? I began working on an interactive 3D scene using Three.js and SCSS. I spent the day setting up the basic structure and importing the necessary libraries and fonts.
